utils

Class JsonReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • utils.JsonReader

  • public class JsonReader
extends java.lang.Object
    Class to read a JSON file in input. It extracts the name of the use case, some optimization parameters, the constraints, and a zone to watch.
    Author:
    PIE_CONSTELLATION

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      JsonReader() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getAlgoName()
      Get the name of the optimization algorithm to use.
      java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double>> getConstraints()
      get the constraints of the problem, a HashMap with the parameter as key and a HashMap with min and max value as value. ex:"nbSat":{"min":1.0,"max":20.0}.
      java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> getOptimisationParameters()
      get the optimization parameters of the problem.

      Get the stop parameters of the optimization algorithm.

      Get the use case ID of the problem.

      Read the Zone to cover in the problem and instantiate a Zone object.

    • Method Detail

      • read

        public void read(java.lang.String jsonFile)
        Read a JSON file and store it in inputData.
        Parameters:
        jsonFile - : the path of the file to read.

      • getUseCaseId

        public int getUseCaseId()
        Get the use case ID of the problem.
        Returns:
        use case ID

      • getOptimisationParameters

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> getOptimisationParameters()
        get the optimization parameters of the problem. (A HashMap with the name of the algorithm and the stopParameters).
        Returns:
        optimization parameters.

      • getAlgoName

        public java.lang.String getAlgoName()
        Get the name of the optimization algorithm to use.
        Returns:
        the name of the algorithm.

      • getStopParameters

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> getStopParameters()
        Get the stop parameters of the optimization algorithm. The stop parameters are in a HashMap with the name of the parameter as key and max value as value.
        Returns:
        stop parameters

      • getConstraints

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double>> getConstraints()
        get the constraints of the problem, a HashMap with the parameter as key and a HashMap with min and max value as value. ex:"nbSat":{"min":1.0,"max":20.0}.
        Returns:
        the constraints.

      • getZone

        public Zone getZone()
        Read the Zone to cover in the problem and instantiate a Zone object. The input Zone is a HashMap with a list of geodetic points and the meshing style longitude and latitude. Example : "zone":{ "meshingStyle":"lat_lon_standard_meshing", "inputPolygon":[ {"lat":43.603950, "lon":1.444510, "alt":143 } , {"lat":43.619355, "lon":1.486368, "alt":154} ]
        Returns:
        the zone to cover.
